DOC.brief_summary: The aim study compare success rate monocanalicular intubation versus bicanalicular silicone intubation congenital nasolacrimal duct obstruction child age 10 36 month .
DOC.brief_title: Monocanalicular Versus Bicanalicular Intubation Treatment Congenital Nasolacrimal Duct Obstruction
DOC.detailed_description: In prospective , nonrandomized comparative study , monocanalicular intubation ( MCI ; n=35 eye ) inferior canaliculus bicanalicular intubation ( BCI ; n=35 eye ) perform general anaeshesia child 10 36 month age suffer congenital nasolacrimal duct obstruction ( CNLDO ) . The tubes remove 3-4 month tube placement . Thereafter , child follow 6 month removal tube . The therapeutic success define fluorescein dye disappearance test grade 0-1 correspond complete resolution previous symptom . The partial success define improvement residual symptom . The complete partial improvement achieve 31/35 ( 88.57 % ) group I BCI 34/35 ( 97.14 % ) group II MCI , respectively , significantly high ( p=0,584 ) . Complications occur group . Dislodgement tube premature removal observe four case group I ( BCI ) , loss tube observe twice group II MCI.. Canalicular slit observe 5 eye group BCI . Granuloma pyogenicum observe 2 case MCI reveal week tube removal . Corneal erosion inferior medial quadrant observe 1 eye MCI reveal day local treatment without tube removal . Conclusions : Both MCI BCI effective method treat CNLDO . The advantage MCI show low incidence canalicular slit easy placement .
DOC.criteria: congenital nasolacrimal duct obstruction ( CNLDO ) resistance conservative therapy and/or probe child young 10 month age
